step.title: End of line testing of the pack

paragraph.htmltext:
After the pack assembly, packs needs to be tested to check if it fulfils the design requirements. Packs that pass the end of line test can be used in the vehicle production. The other packs are scrap and need to be transported to the recycling plant.

In the first step of the testing, the manual service disconnected must be connected. For safety reasons this disconnect should be disconnected as long as possible to reduce the exposure to the highest pack voltages.
A built in diagnostics system can verify if the pack is correctly assembled. The design of the diagnostics shall be done during the design and development of the pack.

During the measuring of the pack, measures need to be taken to avoid electrocution and thermal runaway:

  • Cover the current collector of the pack whenever is possible
  • Use of high voltage gloves
  • Monitoring the temperature can help to detect a thermal runaway in a early stage.
Whenever the pack is lifted or placed during the end of line test the battery pack connectors need to be covered and the temperature need to be checked regularly.
Removing the service disconnect after the end of line testing is seen to be good practice.
